channel.title: Security Application for Windows & Linux
channel.description:
PeerGuardian 2 is Phoenix Labs’ premier IP blocker for Windows. PeerGuardian 2 integrates support for multiple lists, list editing, automatic updates, and blocking all of IPv4 (TCP, UDP, ICMP, etc), making it the safest and easiest way to protect your privacy on P2P.
This grabs a large amount of IP ranges that are labeled: 'Educational, Anti-P2P, Government, Spammer, Rogue, etc' and adds them to the Microsoft equivalent of IPTables with instructions to reject or drop (essentially a null route). [code]http://phoenixlabs.org/pg2/[/code]
moblock-deb provides packages related to IP blocking software, similar to PeerGuardian: In order to protect your privacy internet traffic is blocked based on large lists of IP address ranges. The packages are MoBlock, NFBlock, blockcontrol and mobloquer. This site offers Debian packages for the current Debian and Ubuntu distributions.
On the Linux side, there's Moblock (it uses the same lists as PG2): [code]http://moblock-deb.sourceforge.net/[/code] [b]tl;dr[/b]: These utilities block connections that match the IP range of Government/Anti-P2P entities.

item.title: Security Application for Windows & Linux
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

If it blocks IPs marked ‘educational’ won’t it block university computers that you may be downloading from or block students at the university from downloading from you?

Yes, but you can either whitelist certain ranges or just not block that category.

Read full topic

item.title: Security Application for Windows & Linux
item.dc:creator: @Tulitikku Tulitikku
item.description:
@Tulitikku wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:3, topic:286308”][quote author=Tulitikku link=topic=378651.msg2848006#msg2848006 date=1246387922]
If you want a GUI for Moblock, check out Mobloquer.

[/quote]
That’s on the site. ;)[/quote]God damn… I spent about an hour on Google looking for alternatives to Moblock (I can’t stand using it from the terminal).

Read full topic
